definitions.title: n.pr.loc.
definitions.body: (asylum, cf. Ar. id., Wetzst:ZKW v. 1884, 115)—a royal city of Canaanites, in the South, in tribe of Simeon Nu 14:45 (JE; art. only here v. Di), Nu 21:3 (J) where name expl. from Israel's devoting Canaanites of Arad to destruction; Jos 15:30, Jos 19:4 (P), De 1:44, Jos 12:14 (D), 1Sa 30:30, 1Ch 4:30; originally called [[חְפַת]] Ju Jdg 1:17, where name is said to have been changed to Ḥormah because Judah and Simeon (after death of Joshua) devoted its inhabitants to destruction, v. Di Nu 21:3.—On site v. [[חְפַת]].
